subject: RE: [junit] Software for Unit Testing
msgSnippet: Hi Johannes, Mercury has a tool: http://www-heva.mercuryinteractive.com/accelerate/sept-oct01/technology_focu s/?ad=1118&pl=1032 and I believe Ration, too.
messageBody:
Hi Johannes,

Mercury has a tool:
http://www-heva.mercuryinteractive.com/accelerate/sept-oct01/technology_focu
s/?ad=1118&pl=1032

and I believe Ration, too.

Greetings,
Jorg

>-----Original Message-----
>From: john.link@... [mailto:john.link@...]
>Sent: Friday, August 24, 2001 1:38 PM
>To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [junit] Software for Unit Testing
>
>
>I'm currently compiling a list of open source and commercial software
>for unit testing (and support) in Java. The current contents:
>
>- JUnit and all extensions listed on the Junit web site
>- TestMentor from Silvermark
>- Jtest and Jcontract from Parasoft
>There's certainly more that I don't know of.
>Anyone knows anything else?
>
>Johannes
